name: cyclogenesis
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a fall in air pressure that leads to the forming of a cyclone (= a severe tropical storm): The autumn is a period of high levels of tropical cyclone activity, since sea temperatures remain high enough to promote cyclogenesis. See also
explosive cyclogenesis
More examplesFewer examplesThe combination of moisture meeting cold air led to what is called "cyclogenesis" - the birth of a new storm.Where cyclogenesis occurs, precipitation is enhanced.Tropical cyclones, which form over warm tropical waters, are less frequent in spring since sea temperatures are generally too low for cyclogenesis.
